benefits.title: How does high DHA fish oil affect health? A systematic review of evidence
benefits.summary: High DHA fish oil is beneficial for heart, cardiovascular, and brain function, slowing cognitive decline, and potentially improving immune function.
benefits.journal: Critical Reviews in Food Science and Nutrition

benefits.title: The Effects of Long-Chain Omega-3 Fish Oils and Multivitamins on Cognitive and Cardiovascular Function: A Randomized, Controlled Clinical Trial
benefits.summary: Fish oil decreased aortic pulse pressure and aortic augmentation pressure, but did not consistently improve cognition.
benefits.journal: Journal of the American College of Nutrition

benefits.title: The impact of long-chain n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids on human health
benefits.summary: Fish oil's long-chain n-3 PUFA lower the risk of cardiovascular disease, improve heart muscle function, and may optimize brain and retina development in infants.

benefits.title: Time trend investigation of PCBs, PBDEs, and organochlorine pesticides in selected n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acid rich dietary fish oil and vegetable oil supplements; nutritional relevance for human essential n-3 fatty acid requirements.
benefits.summary: Fish oils have therapeutic benefits in preventing and treating cardiovascular, immunological, and arthritic diseases, as well as childhood deficiency diseases like rickets due to a high content of vitamin D.
benefits.journal: Journal of agricultural and food chemistry

benefits.title: Cosmetic and Therapeutic Applications of Fish Oil’s Fatty Acids on the Skin
benefits.summary: Fish oil supplementation can ameliorate the severity of skin disorders like photoaging, skin cancer, allergy, dermatitis, cutaneous wounds, and melanogenesis.

benefits.title: Fish Oil for Primary and Secondary Prevention of Coronary Heart Disease
benefits.summary: Fish oil supplements are beneficial for primary and secondary cardiovascular prevention, lowering triglyceride levels, preventing atrial fibrillation, reducing mortality rates in congestive heart failure patients, and stabilizing atherosclerotic plaques.

benefits.title: Fish Oil
benefits.summary: Fish oil's Omega-3 fatty acids, EPA and DHA, reduce the risk of heart attack, coronary heart disease, and combat depression, bipolar disorder, and schizophrenia.

benefits.title: Fish, Fish Oils and Cardioprotection: Promise or Fish Tale?
benefits.summary: Fish oil supplementation may decrease the incidence and progression of atherosclerosis, myocardial infarction, heart failure, arrhythmias, and stroke.

benefits.title: Advantages of techniques to fortify food products with the benefits of fish oil.
benefits.summary: Fish oil fortification in food products offers special health benefits due to its high unsaturated fatty acids content, especially DHA and EPA.

benefits.title: Transcriptomic Analysis of the Effects of a Fish Oil Enriched Diet on Murine Brains
benefits.summary: Fish oil enriched diets can enhance nervous system development, reduce amyloidal burden, and improve anxiety, depression, and post-traumatic stress disorder.

side effects.title: Effects of chronic omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acid supplementation on human pulmonary vein and left atrial electrophysiology in paroxysmal atrial fibrillation.
side effects.summary: Chronic fish oil supplementation in patients with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation leads to prolonged pulmonary venous and left atrial effective refractory periods and decreased susceptibility to initiation of atrial fibrillation from within pulmonary veins.

side effects.title: Effect of n-3 fatty acids from fish oil on hemostasis, blood pressure, and lipid profile of dialysis patients.
side effects.summary: Fish oil does not introduce a clinically important risk of bleeding for patients with end-stage renal disease, but may cause gastrointestinal side effects.
side effects.journal: Journal of the American Society of Nephrology : JASN

side effects.title: Fish-oil-containing diet and platelet aggregation.
side effects.summary: Fish oil can prolong bleeding time by reducing platelet aggregability, but over the short term, this dose does not significantly affect platelet function in hospitalized surgical patients.

side effects.title: The Effect of Fish Oil Supplementation on Chemotherapy Side Effects in Patients with Gastric Cancer
side effects.summary: Fish oil supplementation strongly reduces side effects of chemotherapy drugs such as nausea and abdominal cramp in patients with gastric cancer during chemotherapy.
side effects.journal: Journal of Ardabil University of Medical Sciences

side effects.title: Clinical applications of fish oils.
side effects.summary: Fish oil supplements may improve cardiovascular health, but side effects include occasional adverse lipid changes, potential bleeding, vitamin E deficiency, and vitamin A and D toxicity.

side effects.title: The role of fish oil in hypertension.
side effects.summary: Fish oil side effects include gastrointestinal upset, fishy aftertaste, and uncommon clinical bleeding, depending on the dose.

side effects.title: Minerva
side effects.summary: Fish oil side effects include flatulence and diarrhea.

side effects.title: Fish oil disrupts B cell MHC class II lateral organization in the murine immunological synapse
side effects.summary: Fish oil suppresses the recruitment of MHC class II molecules to the immunological synapse, impacting protein lateral organization of B cells and T cells.

side effects.title: Fish Oil Ameliorates Doxorubicin Induced Memory Impairment in Wistar Rats
side effects.summary: Fish oil may be a promising adjuvant therapeutic option for decreasing doxorubicin-related side effects, including memory impairment.
side effects.journal: International Journal of pharma and Bio Sciences

side effects.title: Fish Oil and Heart Health
side effects.summary: Fish oil may exhibit beneficial effects on total and cardiovascular disease mortality, with n-3 fatty acids having anti-inflammatory effects, reducing blood pressure, and potentially being antiatherogenic.

dosage.title: Dietary supplementation with fish oil rich in omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids in children with bronchial asthma.
dosage.summary: Fish oil capsules containing 84 mg EPA and 36 mg DHA were given to children with bronchial asthma for 10 months.

dosage.title: Both Fish Oil and Olive Oil Lowered Plasma Fibrinogen in Women with High Baseline Fibrinogen Levels
dosage.summary: A daily dosage of 6g fish oil lowered plasma fibrinogen levels in women with high baseline levels.

dosage.title: Fish Oil–Induced Changes in Apolipoproteins in IDDM Subjects
dosage.summary: 15 g/day of Max EPA fish oil supplementation led to a significant rise in total cholesterol and LDL cholesterol in IDDM patients.

dosage.title: Decreased Platelet Activity Without Change in Fibrinolytic Activity After Low Dosages of Fish Oil
dosage.summary: Low doses of fish oil (350 mg daily) in microencapsulated form significantly lower platelet aggregability without affecting fibrinolysis.

dosage.title: Omega-3 fatty acids improve the diagnosis-related clinical outcome*
dosage.summary: Fish oil had the most favorable effects on survival, infection rates, and length of stay when administered in doses between 0.1 and 0.2 gkg1day1.

dosage.title: Omega-3 fatty acid dietary supplementation in systemic lupus erythematosus.
dosage.summary: Fish oil supplementation in patients with lupus nephritis involved daily doses of 6g, followed by a washout period, and then 18g daily for five weeks.

dosage.title: Dietary fish oil and olive oil supplementation in patients with rheumatoid arthritis. Clinical and immunologic effects.
dosage.summary: Low-dose fish oil (27 mg/kg EPA and 18 mg/kg DHA) and high-dose fish oil (54 mg/kg EPA and 36 mg/kg DHA) showed significant improvements in tender and swollen joints.

dosage.title: [Long-term effects of low dosage fish oil on serum lipids and lipoproteins].
dosage.summary: Dietary supplementation with 9g fish oil, respectively 3.15g n-3 fatty acids per day, resulted in a decrease of serum-triglycerides by 26% and increase of HDL-cholesterol by 26%.

dosage.title: Maintenance of plasma triglyceride-lowering through use of low-dose fish oils in the diet.
dosage.summary: Low dose fish oil (3g/day) has potential as a maintenance therapy in managing moderate degrees of hypertriglyceridemia.

dosage.title: [Study on the dose-effect relationship of hypolipidemic effect of deepsea fish oil].
dosage.summary: Fish oil dosages of 2.5 g/kg reduce TC and LDL-c levels markedly, with a linear correlation between TG and fish oil levels.
dosage.journal: Wei sheng yan jiu = Journal of hygiene research
